ontological_categorizations.description: What kind of system is it? (e.g. living, non-living; biological, artificial, hybrid; etc.)
ontological_categorizations.examples_from_representative_set: Humans, ... are living and biological while thermostats, ... are non-living and man-made.

origin.description: Where does it come from? (e.g. evolved, engineered, hybrid, unknown)
origin.examples_from_representative_set: Hummans, ... are evolved while others like thermostats are engineered. Some systems like ... are hybrid in origin like ... because ...

goalspace_bounds.description: What is the scale/bounds of its largest goals? (e.g. internal homeostasis, individual survival, social group survival, species survival, planetary stewardship, universal exploration, etc.)
goalspace_bounds.examples_from_representative_set: Humans, ... have unbounded goals while thermostats, ... have very bounded goals.

memory_and_learning.description: How does it store knowledge and learn? (e.g. ...)

agency_and_autonomy.description: How independent is it? (e.g. fully autonomous, semi-autonomous with human-in-the-loop, tool-like with no agency)

substrate.description: What physical or virtual substrate does it operate on? (e.g. biological, mechanical, digital/electronic, quantum, hybrid, etc.)

processing_speed.description: How fast does it process information? (e.g. real-time/reactive vs. deliberative/planning; fast vs. slow)

size.description: What is its physical size or scale? (e.g. microscopic, small, medium, large, planetary-scale, etc.)

abilities.description: What abilities does it have? (e.g. sensory, perceptual, regulatory and action abilities)
